alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Merrimack; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Sullivan, Cheshire, western Hillsborough, southwestern Belknap and Merrimack Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Newport to Vernon. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Concord, Keene, Franklin, Jaffrey, Henniker, New London, Peterborough, Hopkinton, New Boston, Loudon, Winchester, Gilmanton, Antrim, Mont Vernon, Canterbury, Greenfield, Lyndeborough, Bradford, Dublin and Francestown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 2 and 39. Interstate 93 between mile markers 39 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and southern New Hampshire.

area.areaDesc: Belknap; Cheshire; Merrimack; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough
